newsitem.title: GERMANY: Thyssen stock gains 4 pct, DAX up 1 pct.
newsitem.headline: Thyssen stock gains 4 pct, DAX up 1 pct.

text.p: Shares in German steel firm Thyssen AG advanced another four percent on Friday amid speculation that the company will indeed be the subject of a hostile bid by rival Krupp AG, dealers said.
Thyssen ended bourse trade up 15.20 marks, or four percent, at 391 marks. The stock hit a new all-time high of 397 marks in pre-bourse trade.
The DAX index rose 33.57 points, or one percent, to 3,298.24 points.
Krupp and Thyssen have entered talks on a possible merger after Krupp temporarily shelved its takeover offer of 435 marks per share, which it launched earlier this week.

However Krupp plans to resurrect its offer if merger talks do not work out. Speculation that this would be the case was driven by a German newspaper report that Krupp, and associated investors, had a substantial stake in Thyssen.
Krupp, however, denied that it or its banks had any shares in Thyssen. That removed some, but not all, of the speculative interest in Thyssen, dealers said.
"If Krupp really does have shares, then its interest in talks on a steel merger is not too great," one Frankfurt dealer said.
